title: French Onion Soup

ingredients.content: 3 oz Gruyère cheese, cut into pieces
½ tsp salt, plus extra to taste
2 pinches ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
12 slices baguette, slightly stale, or other crusty bread

preparations.content: Place cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>6 sec/speed 7<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.

Place onions, olive oil, butter, salt and pepper into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>, then sauté <b>10-15 min/250°F//speed 1<b>. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl with spatula to loosen caramelized onions.
Sauté a further <b>10-15 min/250°F//speed <b>. Scrape bottom of mixing bowl with spatula to loosen caramelized onions.
Add flour, water and stock cube and mix <b>10 sec//speed 3<b>, then cook <b>20 min/212°F//speed 1<b>. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Preheat oven grill or broiler to 400°F.

Pour soup into ovenproof soup bowls, place 2 baguette slices on top of each bowl and sprinkle with reserved grated Gruyère cheese. Place bowls under the broiler until cheese is melted and slightly brown. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Replace 7 oz of water with 7 oz of white wine.
Sauté the onions up to 15 minutes to increase caramelization although some may stick to the bottom of the mixing bowl.
